Can your woven beach tote do that?By Aliza AbarbanelJune 10, 2019FacebookTwitterEmailPhoto by Alex LauFacebookTwitterEmailThis is Highly Recommend, a column dedicated to our very opinionated editors’ favorite things to eat, drink, and buy.Ice-cold rosé is a picnic staple, essential as baguettes or bug spray, which is why as soon as the first warm spring day arrived, I headed to the park with one of these vintage-designed Mondrian-esque plastic coolers.Designed by Richard Carlson in 1980, this vintage travel cooler is equally functional and adorable. (There’s even one in the MoMA’s permanent collection, so you know it’s chic.) The functional bit comes down to a teensy bit of planning: I fill the removable frozen insert with water and freeze it overnight. By picnic time, it’s ready to keep two wine bottles chilled and chuggable all afternoon, which is ideal because my friends and I aren’t going to drink just one bottle of rosé.The math is simple: more coolers = more wine = more fun.
Photo by Alex LauI ask everyone else (read: my most responsible friends) to bring the rest of the goodies—strawberries, a jar of Castelvetranos—and we’ll be set for hours, ‘cause I’m not budging for a while. I don’t know about you, but I have two bottles of rosé to sip, and I definitely didn’t battle a bunch of teenage couples to leave before sunset.
